column5: Well Today was a nice day so I figured I better get the boat going... May 24 is fast approaching!  I made sure when I first purchased the boat that I got the front floor done... as it on such an incline I could see an ankle being snapped.... I left it at that... knowing full well I would be starting the rear Floor this spring...  This is to give the guys out there looking at doing their floor a bit of insight   Main Brackets     Cross members      The small rear section...          I also got my new GPS Chartplotter installed today... Works like a champ!  Now to cut the Marine Plywood and put in the decking...  Add the new FishFinder  and the Stereo...  Now... please let weather stay nice!!!!!  G

Awesome stuff Gerritt!  I hope this means you are starting to feel better now!  I'll be taking the boat out of the garage next weekend....start the motor, mount some rod holders, lighting check etc...  Ahhh....I can almost taste open water fishing....
Its lookin good Bud now would you mind cleaning the boat next time you send us pics

Ahhh Yes... I need to vacuum and wash her down before the floor goes in... She is sleeping amoungst the trees... and this is the first time I have had her open since last fall.... some crap got in there...  She says she is sorry she showed her dirty dirty Diiiiiiiiirty behind  G
Nice going Gerritt glad to see you're getting it fixed up nice!
Looks good, Hope you will post some more as you progress.  Is that Aluminum stock bar and Aluminum Angle Brackets, or is it SS.
awesome job Gerritt gonna be nice,where did ya mount the plotter,Ice here on the bay is going fast thankfully its been a long winter

Lookin Good G, but yes, Clean it before you show it hahaha. I too got some stuff going. Put some new Submersible LED's on the small Trailer today along with New Wiring. Lets see if these buggers last like they should. $80 for the set, they better be worth it.
Gerrit, Lookin' great Bud! Even with your raised decking she still looks nice an deep. Looking forward to seeing the next steps completed. Be good. pete

1/8" Aluminium Stock kinda heavy duty... but I only plan on doing this once! LOL...  the GPS unit is located on a RAM mount... and the FF is located beside it....  I will be sure to post some more pics as I progress...  G
Geez....Seeing everyone working on their boats or out fishing is driving me crazy. Soon.....Soon ......Soon ..........................Aaarrrrrrrggggggggg!
It'll be at least a month before I get to that chore Gerritt. In fact we had a snow storm move in last night after several 12 and 13C days. Back to winter for a while now.
Bernie, Dan....   Trust me you will all have time to open your wallets LOL... better to delay the inevitable!  G
GEEZ if I'd have known you were working on the boat I would have stopped over as I was out running around today
Hey Gerritt - did you pick up a marine radio yet?

I was there @ Angling Outfitters yesterday... Jos almost had me grabbing one.... Expect I already had my budget in my hands... I will probably pick up the Lowrance unit next month.. then add the 8' Antenna....  will it ever end? LOL   Did you pick it up yet??? and what about your experiment?? conclusion?  G
Nice job Gerritt look forward to seeing it finished  Rob
Looks good, Gerritt. Smart move using the aluminum bracing. I did the same thing to my ride last year. Its expensive, sure. But you'll never have to touch it again. Keep up the good work!
Good down next weekend to pick up a few more Catalinas and most likely a radio.  Experiment remains a work in progress....  :-)
Geeeesh...Crappieperchhunter has his boat all ready to roll...you guys are working on yours...  The "Tin" is still buried in two feet of snow...    Ain't that a sad lookin' sight ?
you've put alot of hours and labour G...it's really showing nicely...you're doing a great start to finish job. Can't wait to see it complete....keep the pics and progress coming
Hey Gerritt,  Looks good so far, keeping track of the budget for the rest of us? What type of boat is that?  Are you making a front deck?  forrest

So far I have about 300.00 into the floor (aluminium is not cheap).... I did the front last year forrest, now I just need to plywood and vinyl the rear  w00t!  Thanks Vatordude... I hope to have i finished next weekend!  G
Looking very good Gerritt. Keep us posted on the progress. Hope to get mine out of storage today.
